metadata.Title: CVE-2017-13134 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In ImageMagick 7.0.6-6 and GraphicsMagick 1.3.26, a heap-based buffer over-read was found in the function SFWScan in coders/sfw.c, which allows attackers to cause a denial of service via a crafted file. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-13134` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.3
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.3
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.3
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.3
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.23-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> 0292-CVE-2017-13134-Fix-heap-based-buffer-overflow-in-SFWScan.patch in wheezy 0249-CVE-2017-13134.patch in jessie 0100-CVE-2017-13134.patch in stretch

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.23-1ubuntu0.3').
imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.11').
